DataElement.preferredName: LARS Score 3 V1 How Often Open Bowels Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated response of how often they open their bowels, using a 4 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lower Anterior Resection Syndrome Score How Often Open Bowels Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.:A question about how often an individual has or had bowel movements._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.

Concepts.definition: A standardized five-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about how often an individual has or had bowel movements._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about how often an individual has or had bowel movements.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Scale Low Anterior Resection Syndrome Bowel Continence

PermissibleValues.value: More than 7 times per day (24 hours)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: More than 7 times per day (24 hours)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: More than 7 times per day within 24 hours

PermissibleValues.value: Less than once per day (24 hours)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less than once per day (24 hours)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Less than once per day within 24 hours

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Low Anterior Resection Syndrome Bowel Continence Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A collection of symptoms following removal of part or all of the rectum that may include frequency or urgency of stools, numerous bowel movements over a few hours, fecal incontinence, constipation alternating with numerous bowel movements, and/or increased intestinal gas._A question about an individual's ability to control their bowels._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

Concepts.definition: A collection of symptoms following removal of part or all of the rectum that may include frequency or urgency of stools, numerous bowel movements over a few hours, fecal incontinence, constipation alternating with numerous bowel movements, and/or increased intestinal gas.
A question about an individual's ability to control their bowels.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: How often do you open your bowels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Low Anterior Resection Syndrome Score (LARS) Version 1.0
